message.content:
cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.DL, cs.SI, cs.LG

The paper discusses the use of Kuhnian philosophy to construct an ontology for classifying and evaluating the impact of STM scholarly articles. The paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) as it discusses the classification of scholarly articles based on their contribution to paradigm-centred knowledge. It could also belong to Information Retrieval (cs.IR) as it deals with the classification and evaluation of scholarly articles. Deep Learning (cs.DL) is another likely sub-category as it involves the use of machine learning techniques to construct the ontology. Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) and Machine Learning (cs.LG) are also possible sub-categories as they are related to the use of machine learning techniques and the analysis of scholarly articles.
